creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
ATM the release management guidelines on the website and on the Wiki differ
quite significantly. We should agree on a single policy.

http://lenya.apache.org/docs/release.html
http://wiki.apache.org/lenya/ProjectReleaseHowTo

I started a draft page in the wiki:
http://wiki.apache.org/lenya/ProposalReleaseGuidelines
creator: andreas@apache.org

text: After 24 revisions over 2 months I think Andreas and others have http://wiki.apache.org/lenya/ProposalReleaseGuidelines in pretty good shape now.  I suggest we put its contents into the http://lenya.apache.org/docs/release.html page and remove the http://wiki.apache.org/lenya/ProposalReleaseGuidelines  and http://wiki.apache.org/lenya/ProjectReleaseHowTo wiki pages.  WDYT?
creator: bobharner@gmail.com
nettings@apache.org
text:
+1

is anyone at it already? if not, i could prepare a rough version as a patch, but
somebody with a working forrest installation would have to check it.

committed to docu/src/documentation/content/xdocs/docs/release.xml
please review, some FIXMEs remain.
creator: nettings@apache.org
